page.title: 17TOURISM IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON}is not at first glance an obvious area for tourists but it has a fair number of people travelling through it for that reason. Two homes in the area supply bed and breakfast for visitors and there is a steady stream of visitors during the summer months. The recent erection of the Humber Bridge has made Lincolnshire more accessible to travellers from the north and the bridge itself is a tourist attraction. Visitors come to the area from all over the world to visit Lincoln with its history and its beautiful cathedral. Lincolnshire also attracts cyclists and walkers. Most visitors to {PANTON }remark on the beauty of the landscape and the feeling of space. The current average rates for bed and breakfast are Â£7 for bed and breakfast per person and Â£2.5O for an evening meal.
